Provides 2024 Outlook for Integrated Company</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:4pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">DENVER, February&#160;22, 2024 &#8211; Newmont Corporation (NYSE&#58; NEM, TSX&#58; NGT, ASX&#58; NEM, PNGX&#58; NEM) (Newmont or the Company) today announced fourth quarter and full year 2023 results, as well as its 2024 outlook.  </font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#34;2023 was a transformational year for Newmont, and for all of our stakeholders,&#34; said Tom Palmer, Newmont's President and Chief Executive Officer. &#34;With the acquisition of Newcrest now complete, our principal focus for 2024 is to integrate and transform our leading portfolio of Tier 1 assets into a unique collection of the world's best gold and copper operations and projects. With stable production and structured reinvestment throughout the year, we are strongly positioned to deliver on our commitments in 2024 and set the stage for meaningful growth in 2025 and beyond.&#34;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">2023 Results</font><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">1</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:3pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:15.37pt">Completed the acquisition of Newcrest Mining Limited on November 6, 2023, creating the world&#8217;s leading gold company with robust copper optionality</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:15.37pt">Delivered $1.4 billion in dividends to shareholders in 2023 </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:3pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:15.37pt">Produced 5.5 million gold ounces and 891 thousand gold equivalent ounces (GEOs)</font><font the legacy Newcrest assets from the acquisition close date</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:3pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:15.37pt">Updated Tanami Expansion 2 development capital estimate of $1.7 to $1.8 billion with commercial production expected in the second half of 2027 </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;margin-top:3pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open 2025</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">7</font></div><div style="margin-top:16pt"><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:20.416%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:98.900%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr style="height:3pt"><td colspan="3" style="border-top:1pt solid #000;padding:0 1pt"></td></tr></table></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:3.9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.1pt;vertical-align:baseline">1 </font><font See notes at the end of this release.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:3.9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.1pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Gold equivalent ounces (GEOs) calculated using Gold ($1,400&#47;oz.), Copper ($3.50&#47;lb.), Silver ($20.00&#47;oz.), Lead ($1.00&#47;lb.) and Zinc ($1.20&#47;lb.) pricing for 2023.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:3.9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.1pt;vertical-align:baseline">3 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">Non-GAAP metrics&#59; see reconciliations at the end of this release.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:3.9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.1pt;vertical-align:baseline">4</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Total resources presented includes Measured and Indicated resources of 104.8 million gold ounces and Inferred resources of 69.1 million gold ounces. See cautionary statement at the end of this release. </font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:3.9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.1pt;vertical-align:baseline">5</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> See discussion of outlook, including the definition of the Tier 1 Portfolio, and cautionary statement at the end of this release regarding forward-looking statements.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:3.9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.1pt;vertical-align:baseline">6</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Newmont&#8217;s go-forward portfolio is focused on Tier 1 assets, consisting of (1) six managed Tier 1 assets (Boddington, Tanami, Cadia, Lihir, Pe&#241;asquito and Ahafo), (2) assets owned through two non-managed joint ventures at Nevada Gold Mines and Pueblo Viejo, including four Tier 1 assets (Carlin, Cortez, Turquoise Ridge and Pueblo Viejo), (3) three emerging Tier 1 assets (Merian, Cerro Negro and Yanacocha), which do not currently meet the criteria for Tier 1 Asset, and (4) an emerging Tier 1 district in the Golden Triangle in British Columbia (Red Chris and Brucejack), which does not currently meet the criteria for Tier 1 Asset. Newmont&#8217;s Tier 1 portfolio also includes attributable production from the Company&#8217;s equity interest in Lundin Gold (Fruta del Norte). Tier 1 Portfolio cost and capital metrics include the proportional share of the Company&#8217;s interest in the Nevada Gold Mines joint venture.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:3.9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.1pt;vertical-align:baseline">7</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Synergies are a management estimate provided for illustrative purposes and should not be considered a GAAP or non-GAAP financial measure. Synergies represent management&#8217;s combined estimate of pre-tax synergies, supply chain efficiencies and Full Potential improvements, as a result of the integration of Newmont&#8217;s and Newcrest&#8217;s businesses that have been monetized for the purposes of the estimation. Such estimates are necessarily imprecise and are based on numerous judgments and assumptions. Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">1,067&#160;</font></td><td style="background-color:#f2f2f2;border-bottom:0.5pt solid #0c2b82;border-top:0.5pt solid #0c2b82;padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%">FOURTH QUARTER 2023 KEY RESULTS DRIVERS</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">In the fourth quarter, Newmont delivered a sequential improvement in production compared to the third quarter, primarily driven by the inclusion of the sites acquired in the Newcrest transaction combined with higher production at all Newmont managed operations except for Boddington, Yanacocha and CC&#38;V due to planned mine sequencing. In addition, Newmont's non-managed operations at Nevada Gold Mines and Pueblo Viejo delivered higher production during the quarter. Notably, Pe&#241;asquito safely ramped up operations after a resolution of the labor strike was reached with the National Union of Mine and Metal Workers of the Mexican Republic (&#34;the Union&#34;) on October 13, 2023. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Excluding the impact from the acquisition of Newcrest, direct operating costs were largely consistent with the third quarter as inflationary pressures have continued to stabilize, with improvements to commodity input pricing, partially offset by higher third party royalties due to higher gold prices. AISC was higher due to increased sustaining capital during the fourth quarter compared to the third quarter. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Cash Flow from Continuing Operations and Free Cash Flow were both lower than the third quarter at $616 million and $(304) million, respectively. This was primarily driven by unfavorable working capital changes of $297 million compared to the third quarter, including an unfavorable build of accounts receivable and the timing of accounts payable, as well as higher current cash tax and timing of debt interest payments. In addition, Newmont invested $920&#160;million in capital spend during the fourth quarter, including $377 million in development capital spend to continue to progress near-term projects and $543 million in sustaining capital to progress site improvement projects.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Newmont reported a GAAP Net Loss from Continuing Operations of $(3.2) billion. Adjusted Net Income increased to $486 million or $0.50 per share, primarily driven by higher sales volumes and higher realized gold prices compared to the third quarter. Adjusted Net Income excludes significant non-cash accounting charges, primarily related to impairment charges of $1.9 billion recorded at year end in conjunction with the Company's annual impairment review and reclamation charges of $1.2 billion. In addition, Newmont incurred $427 million of costs related to the acquisition and integration of Newcrest.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:4pt;margin-top:4pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#0a2299;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:14.62pt">$1.9 billion of impairment charges primarily due to the write-down of goodwill of $1.2 billion at Pe&#241;asquito, $293 million at Musselwhite and $246 million at &#201;l&#233;onore  </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:4pt;margin-top:4pt;padding-left:72pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#9702;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:14.93pt">The goodwill impairment at Pe&#241;asquito was driven by an update to the geological model that impacted expected metal grade and recoveries, resulting in lower underlying cash flows</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:4pt;margin-top:4pt;padding-left:72pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#9702;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:14.93pt">The goodwill impairments at Musselwhite and &#201;l&#233;onore were driven by a deterioration in underlying cash flows as a result of higher costs due to inflationary pressures</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:4pt;margin-top:4pt;padding-left:72pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#9702;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:14.93pt">The long-lived assets at all three sites were evaluated for impairment and no impairment was identified</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:4pt;margin-top:4pt;padding-left:72pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#9702;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:14.93pt">The site-specific goodwill amounts originated from the Goldcorp purchase price allocation in 2019, which was based on best estimates of each site's value and country-risk assumptions at that time</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;margin-top:3pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:14.62pt">$1.2 billion reclamation adjustment charges primarily at Yanacocha due to increased estimated water management costs</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;margin-top:3pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:14.62pt">$427 million of Newcrest transaction and integration costs&#59; primarily due to the accrual of $316 million in stamp duty tax incurred in connection with the transaction</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Newmont intends to file its 2023 Form 10-K on or about the close of business on February 27, 2024. </font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">NEWMONT FULL YEAR AND FOURTH QUARTER 2023 RESULTS &#38; 2024 GUIDANCE &#124; NEWS RELEASE       &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:86.4pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><img alt="image.jpg" src="image.jpg" style="height:98px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:818px"></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%">FOURTH QUARTER 2023 FINANCIAL AND PRODUCTION SUMMARY</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Attributable gold production</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">1</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> for the fourth quarter increased 7 percent to 1,741 thousand ounces compared to the prior year quarter, primarily due to the addition of the Newcrest operations in November 2023. This favorable impact was partially offset by lower production at Pe&#241;asquito, Boddington and Akyem. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Gold sales</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> were slightly higher than production for the quarter primarily due to the timing of shipments at Cadia and Telfer.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Gold CAS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> totaled $1.9 billion for the quarter. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Gold CAS per ounce</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> increased 16 percent to $1,086 per ounce compared to the prior year quarter, primarily due to higher direct operating costs incurred at the Newcrest sites after the acquisition, including at Brucejack and Telfer as operations at both sites were temporarily suspended for a portion of December, as well as higher costs incurred at Nevada Gold Mines due to leach pad write-downs and at Merian and Cerro Negro due to increased inflationary pressures on labor and consumables costs. These increases were partially offset by lower costs incurred at Pe&#241;asquito as the site ramped up to full productivity in the fourth quarter of 2023 after the resolution of the labor strike in October 2023. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Gold AISC per ounce</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> increased 22 percent to $1,485 per ounce compared to the prior year quarter, primarily due to higher CAS per ounce and higher sustaining capital spend.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Attributable GEO production from other metals</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> for the quarter</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">remained largely flat at 289 thousand ounces from the prior year quarter, primarily due to the addition of copper production from Cadia, Red Chris and Telfer, partially offset by the ramp-up of production at Pe&#241;asquito after the resolution of the labor strike.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%"> Other metal GEO sales</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> were slightly higher than production for the quarter, primarily due to the timing of shipments at Cadia and Telfer.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">CAS from other metals</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> totaled $403 million for the quarter. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">CAS per GEO</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> increased 46 percent to $1,254 per ounce from the prior year quarter, primarily due to a higher allocation of costs to co-product metals with the addition of co-product production at Cadia, Red Chris and Telfer.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">AISC per GEO</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> for the quarter increased 46 percent to $1,697 per ounce from the prior year quarter, primarily due to higher CAS from other metals, higher sustaining capital spend and higher treatment and refining costs.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Average realized gold price</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> for the quarter increased $246 per ounce to $2,004 per ounce compared to the prior year quarter, including $2,003 per ounce of gross price received, the favorable impact of $13 per ounce mark-to-market on provisionally-priced sales and $12 per ounce reductions for treatment and refining charges.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Revenue</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> for the quarter increased 24 percent to $4.0 billion compared to the prior year quarter, primarily due to higher sales volumes and higher realized gold prices. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Net loss from continuing operations</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> attributable to Newmont stockholders for the quarter was $(3.2) billion or $(3.22) per diluted share, a decrease of $1.7&#160;billion from the prior year quarter, primarily due to higher impairment charges recognized primarily related to the write-off of goodwill at Pe&#241;asquito, Musselwhite and &#201;l&#233;onore, as well as higher reclamation and remediation expense resulting from adjustments mainly related to non-operating Yanacocha sites.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Adjusted net income</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> for the quarter was $486 million or $0.50 per diluted share compared to $348 million or $0.44 per diluted share in the prior year quarter. Primary adjustments to fourth quarter net income include reclamation and remediation adjustments of $1.2 billion, total impairment charges of $1.9 billion, and Newcrest transaction and integration costs of $427 million.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Adjusted EBITDA</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> for the quarter increased 19 percent to $1.4 billion for the quarter compared to $1.2 billion for the prior year quarter.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Capital expenditures</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">4</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> increased 42 percent to $920&#160;million for the quarter compared to prior year quarter, primarily due to higher sustaining capital spend as well as slightly higher development capital spend.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Consolidated operating cash flow from continuing operations </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">decreased 39 percent to $616 million for the quarter compared to the prior year quarter, primarily due to the impact of the Pe&#241;asquito strike, which was partially offset by higher average realized gold prices.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%"> </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Free Cash Flow</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">5</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">decreased to $(304) million for the quarter compared to the prior year quarter, primarily due to lower operating cash flow and higher capital expenditures. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Nevada Gold Mines (NGM)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">6</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">attributable gold production for the quarter was 322 thousand ounces, with CAS of $1,125 per ounce</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> and AISC of $1,482 per ounce</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Pueblo Viejo (PV)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">7</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">attributable gold production was 61 thousand ounces for the quarter. Cash distributions received from the Company's equity method investment in Pueblo Viejo were $8 million for the fourth quarter. Capital contributions of $16 million for the quarter were made related to the expansion project at Pueblo Viejo.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Fruta del Norte</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">8</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">attributable gold production is reported on a quarterly lag and will not be reported until the first quarter of 2024. Cash distributions received from the Company's equity method investment in Fruta del Norte were $6 million for the fourth quarter.</font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">NEWMONT FULL YEAR AND FOURTH QUARTER 2023 RESULTS &#38; 2024 GUIDANCE &#124; NEWS RELEASE       &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:86.4pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><img alt="image.jpg" src="image.jpg" style="height:98px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:818px"></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%">FULL YEAR 2023 FINANCIAL AND PRODUCTION SUMMARY</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Attributable gold production</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">1</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> for the year decreased 7 percent to 5,545 thousand ounces compared to the prior year, primarily due to lower production at Pe&#241;asquito, Akyem, Merian and Boddington. In addition, the non-managed joint venture at Pueblo Viejo delivered lower production than in the prior year. These unfavorable impacts were partially offset by the addition of the Newcrest operations in November 2023. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Gold sales</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> were largely in line with production for the year.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Gold CAS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> totaled $5.7 billion for the year. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Gold CAS per ounce</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> increased 13 percent to $1,050 per ounce compared to the prior year, primarily due to lower gold sales volumes, higher maintenance costs and higher materials, labor and contract services costs. These increases were partially offset by lower costs incurred at Pe&#241;asquito during the labor strike and lower profit-sharing in 2023 due to lower taxable income at the site.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Gold AISC per ounce</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> increased 19 percent to $1,444 per ounce compared to the prior year, primarily due to higher CAS per ounce and higher sustaining capital spend.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Attributable GEO production from other metals</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> for the year decreased 30 percent to 891 thousand ounces compared to the prior year, primarily due to the Pe&#241;asquito labor strike in 2023, partially offset by the addition of copper production from Cadia, Red Chris and Telfer. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Other metal GEO sales</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> were largely in line with production for the year.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">CAS from other metals</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> totaled $1.0 billion for the year. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">CAS per GEO</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> increased 38 percent to $1,127 per ounce from the prior year, primarily due to lower sales volumes as a result of the Pe&#241;asquito labor strike in 2023.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">AISC per GEO</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> for the year increased 42 percent to $1,577 per ounce from the prior year, primarily due to lower sales volumes as a result of the Pe&#241;asquito labor strike in 2023 and higher sustaining capital spend.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Average realized gold price</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> for the year increased $162 per ounce to $1,954 per ounce compared to the prior year, including $1,957 per ounce of gross price received, the favorable impact of $6 per ounce mark-to-market on provisionally-priced sales and $9 per ounce reductions for treatment and refining charges. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Revenue</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> for the year remained largely flat at $11.8 billion compared to $11.9 billion for the prior year. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Net loss from continuing operations </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">attributable to Newmont stockholders for the year was $(2.5) billion or $(2.97) per diluted share, a decrease of $2.0&#160;billion from the prior year primarily due to higher impairment charges, higher reclamation and remediation expense resulting from adjustments, primarily related to non-operating Yanacocha sites, the impact of the Pe&#241;asquito labor strike, and the Newcrest transaction and integration costs, including the accrual of a stamp duty tax of $316&#160;million. These decreases were partially offset by higher average realized prices for gold, silver and copper.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Adjusted net income</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> for the year was $1.4 billion or $1.61 per diluted share compared to $1.5 billion or $1.85 per diluted share in the prior year. Primary adjustments to 2023 net income include total impairment charges of $1.9 billion, reclamation and remediation adjustments of $1.3 billion, and Newcrest transaction and integration costs of $464 million. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Adjusted EBITDA</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> for the year decreased 7 percent to $4.2 billion, compared to $4.6 billion for the prior year. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Capital expenditures</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">4</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> increased 25 percent to $2.7&#160;billion for the full year compared to prior year, primarily due to higher sustaining capital spend as well as slightly higher development capital spend. Development capital expenditures in 2023 primarily related to Tanami Expansion 2, Yanacocha Sulfides, Ahafo North, Cerro Negro District Expansion 1, Pamour, Cadia Block Caves, and the TS Solar Plant and Goldrush Complex at Nevada Gold Mines.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Consolidated operating cash flow from continuing operations </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">decreased 14 percent to $2.8 billion for the full year compared to the prior year, primarily due to the impact of the Pe&#241;asquito strike and lower sales volumes at Akyem. These impacts were partially offset by income provided by the newly acquired sites and higher average realized gold, silver and copper prices.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Free Cash Flow</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">5</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">decreased to $88 million for the full year compared to $1.1 billion for the prior year, primarily due to lower operating cash flow and higher capital expenditures. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Balance sheet and liquidity </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">remained strong in 2023, ending the year with $3.0 billion of consolidated cash, with approximately $6.1 billion of total liquidity&#59; reported net debt to adjusted EBITDA of 1.1x</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">9</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Nevada Gold Mines (NGM)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">7</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">attributable gold production for the year was 1,170 thousand ounces, with CAS of $1,070 per ounce</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> and AISC of $1,397 per ounce</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Pueblo Viejo (PV)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">8</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">attributable gold production was 224 thousand ounces for the year. Cash distributions received from the Company's equity method investment in Pueblo Viejo were $106 million for the year. Capital contributions of $97 million for the year were made related to the expansion project at Pueblo Viejo.<br></font><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:37.083%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:98.900%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr style="height:3pt"><td colspan="3" style="border-top:1pt solid #000;padding:0 1pt"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">1</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Attributable gold production includes 61 thousand ounces for the fourth quarter of 2023, 52 thousand ounces for the third quarter of 2023, 65 thousand ounces for the fourth quarter of 2022, 224 thousand ounces for the year ended December 31, 2023 and 285 thousand ounces for the year ended December 31, 2022 from the Company's equity method investment in Pueblo Viejo (40%). </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Non-GAAP measure. See end of this release for reconciliation to Costs applicable to sales.</font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">NEWMONT FULL YEAR AND FOURTH QUARTER 2023 RESULTS &#38; 2024 GUIDANCE &#124; NEWS RELEASE       &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;4</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:86.4pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><img alt="image.jpg" src="image.jpg" style="height:98px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:818px"></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Non-GAAP measure. See end of this release for reconciliation to Net income (loss) attributable to Newmont stockholders.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">4</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Capital expenditures refers to Additions to property plant and mine development from the Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">5</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Non-GAAP measure. See end of this release for reconciliation to Net cash provided by operating activities.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">6</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Newmont has a 38.5% interest in Nevada Gold Mines in the U.S., which is accounted for using the proportionate consolidation method. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">7</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Newmont has a 40% interest in Pueblo Viejo, which is accounted for as an equity method investment.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">8</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Newmont has a 32% interest in Lundin Gold, who wholly owns and operates the Fruta del Norte mine, which is accounted for on a quarterly-lag as an equity method investment.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">9</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Non-GAAP measure. See end of this release for reconciliation.</font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">NEWMONT FULL YEAR AND FOURTH QUARTER 2023 RESULTS &#38; 2024 GUIDANCE &#124; NEWS RELEASE       &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;5</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div></div></div><div id="i62d511a7173f4cbb96b37eb0677fb474_7"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:86.4pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><img alt="image.jpg" src="image.jpg" style="height:98px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:818px"></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Disciplined Reinvestment into Key Near-Term Projects </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">Newmont&#8217;s project pipeline supports stable production with improving margins and mine life</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">1</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">. Newmont's 2024 outlook includes current development capital costs and production related to Tanami Expansion 2, Ahafo North, Cadia Block Caves and Cerro Negro District Expansion 1. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:9pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:14.62pt;text-decoration:underline">Ahafo North</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> (Ghana) expands our existing footprint in Ghana with four open pit mines and a stand-alone mill located approximately 30 kilometers from the Company&#8217;s Ahafo South operations. The project is expected to add between 275,000 and 325,000 ounces per year with all-in sustaining costs of $800 to $900 per ounce for the first five full years of production (2026 - 2030). Ahafo North is the best unmined gold deposit in West Africa with approximately 4.1 million ounces of Reserves and 1.3 million ounces of Measured, Indicated and Inferred Resources</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> and significant upside potential to extend beyond Ahafo North&#8217;s current 13-year mine life. Commercial production for the project is expected in the second half of 2025. Total capital costs are estimated to be between $950 and $1,050 million. Development costs (excluding capitalized interest) since approval were $375 million, of which $163 million related to 2023. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:9pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:14.62pt;text-decoration:underline">Cadia Block Caves</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> (Australia) includes two existing panel caves to recover approximately 5.9 million ounces of Gold Reserves as well as 1.3 million tonnes of Copper Reserves. First ore has been delivered from the first panel cave (PC2-3), and development is underway at the second panel cave (PC1-2). The newly-acquired project is currently under review, and a more fulsome update on the anticipated metrics is expected to be provided in the second half of 2024. Development capital costs (excluding capitalized interest) since approval were $36 million, of which all related to 2023.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:9pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Wingdings',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:14.93pt;text-decoration:underline">Cerro Negro District Expansion 1</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> (Argentina) includes the simultaneous development of the Marianas and Eastern districts to extend the mine life of Cerro Negro beyond 2030. The project is expected to improve production and provides a platform for further exploration and future growth through additional expansions. Development capital costs for the project are estimated to be between $350 and $450 million. In the third quarter of 2023, Newmont declared commercial production for San Marcos, the first of six ore bodies associated with the expansion project.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:9pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:14.62pt;text-decoration:underline">Tanami Expansion 2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> (Australia) secures Tanami&#8217;s future as a long-life, low-cost producer by extending mine life beyond 2040 through the addition of a 1,460 meter hoisting shaft and supporting infrastructure to process 3.3 million tonnes per year and provide a platform for future growth. The expansion is expected to increase average annual gold production by approximately 150,000 to 200,000 ounces per year for the first five years and reduce operating costs by approximately 30 percent, bringing average all-in sustaining costs to $900 to $1,000 per ounce for Tanami (2028 - 2032). As a result of the identification of required overbreak and underbreak remediation, commercial production for the project is now expected in the second half of 2027. Total capital costs are now estimated to be between $1.7 and $1.8 billion, incorporating the required remediation work. Development costs (excluding capitalized interest) since approval were $752&#160;million, of which $253 million related to 2023. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font><br></font></div><div 1pt"></td></tr></table></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open macroeconomic and geopolitical conditions, changes in interest</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">rates, inflation, commodities and raw materials prices, supply chain disruptions, labor markets, engineering and mine plan assumptions, future funding decisions,</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">consideration of strategic capital allocation and other factors, which may impact estimated capital expenditures, AISC and timing of projects. See end of this release for</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">cautionary statement regarding forward-looking statements. </font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> Total resources presented for Ahafo North includes Measured and Indicated resources of 1 million gold ounces and Inferred resources of 300 thousand gold ounces. See cautionary statement at the end of this release. </font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">NEWMONT FULL YEAR AND FOURTH QUARTER 2023 RESULTS &#38; 2024 GUIDANCE &#124; NEWS RELEASE       &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;6</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div></div></div><div id="i62d511a7173f4cbb96b37eb0677fb474_10"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:86.4pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><img alt="image.jpg" src="image.jpg" style="height:98px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:818px"></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">2024 Outlook Underpinned by Optimized Tier 1 Portfolio</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:112%">Based on a comprehensive review undertaken following the Newcrest acquisition, Newmont&#8217;s Board of Directors and senior</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">leadership team have identified the Tier 1 Portfolio which is expected to generate the most value over the long-term. Newmont&#8217;s go-forward portfolio is focused on Tier 1 assets, consisting of (1) six managed Tier 1 assets (Boddington, Tanami, Cadia, Lihir, Pe&#241;asquito and Ahafo), (2) assets owned through two non-managed joint ventures at Nevada Gold Mines and Pueblo Viejo, including four Tier 1 assets (Carlin, Cortez, Turquoise Ridge and Pueblo Viejo), (3) three emerging Tier 1 assets (Merian, Cerro Negro and Yanacocha), which do not currently meet the criteria for Tier 1 Asset, and (4) an emerging Tier 1 district in the Golden Triangle in British Columbia (Red Chris and Brucejack), which does not currently meet the criteria for Tier 1 Asset. Newmont&#8217;s Tier 1 portfolio also includes attributable production from the Company&#8217;s equity interest in Lundin Gold (Fruta del Norte). Tier 1 Portfolio cost and capital metrics include the proportional share of the Company&#8217;s interest in the Nevada Gold Mines Joint Venture. As part of Newmont&#8217;s portfolio optimization, the company is seeking to divest six non-core assets&#58; Akyem, CC&#38;V, &#201;l&#233;onore, Porcupine, Musselwhite, and Telfer. In addition, Newmont expects to divest the Coffee project in Canada and the Havieron project in Australia. </font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:112%">PRODUCTION AND COST OUTLOOK</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><table style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Consolidated basis</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Newmont's 2024 outlook is supported by steady production from Newmont's managed Tier 1 and Emerging Tier 1 assets, and is further enhanced by the Company&#8217;s ownership in the Nevada Gold Mines and Pueblo Viejo joint ventures. These assets form the core of Newmont's 2024 attributable production outlook for the Tier 1 Portfolio of approximately 5.6 million ounces. Total Newmont gold production is expected to be 6.9 million ounces, incorporating the incremental 1.3 million ounces from the six non-core assets.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Costs in 2024 are expected to remain in line with 2023, with CAS of approximately of $1,000 per ounce for the Tier 1 Portfolio.  AISC for the Tier 1 Portfolio is expected to be approximately $1,300 per ounce in 2024, incorporating higher sustaining capital spend compared to the prior year. </font></div><div acquisition of Newcrest is expected to increase Newmont's Tier 1 Portfolio copper production. This will be partially offset by lower copper production expected from Boddington as the site progresses laybacks in 2024. In addition, Pe&#241;asquito is expected to deliver higher co-product production due to higher silver, lead and zinc content from the Chile Colorado pit.</font></div><div style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">*Sustaining capital is presented on an attributable basis&#59; Capital outlook excludes amounts attributable to the Pueblo Viejo joint venture </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Sustaining capital is expected to be approximately $1.5 billion in 2024 for the Tier 1 Portfolio, covering key tailings management, water and infrastructure projects, equipment and ongoing mine development. Total Newmont sustaining capital is expected to be approximately $1.8 billion in 2024, incorporating incremental spend at the six non-core assets.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">Development capital is expected to be approximately $1.2 billion in 2024 for the Tier 1 Portfolio, as the Company focuses on disciplined reinvestment in its most profitable near-term projects. 2024 outlook primarily includes spend for Tanami Expansion 2 in Australia, Ahafo North in Ghana, Cadia Block Caves in Australia and Cerro Negro District Expansion 1 in Argentina. In addition, development capital outlook includes spend related to the Company&#8217;s ownership interest in Nevada Gold Mines including Goldrush. Total Newmont development capital is expected to be approximately $1.3 billion in 2024, incorporating incremental spend for the Pamour project at Porcupine.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Development capital estimates exclude contributions to support Newmont&#8217;s 40% interest in the Pueblo Viejo expansion, which is accounted for as an equity method investment.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%">EXPLORATION AND ADVANCED PROJECTS OUTLOOK</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;margin-top:3pt"><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:66.666%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:71.191%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:26.609%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="background-color:#0c2b82;padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle"><div><font style="color:#ffffff;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Guidance Metric</font></div></td><td colspan="3" style="background-color:#0c2b82;border-left:0.5pt solid #ffffff;padding:2px 1pt;text-align:center;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#ffffff;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">2024E</font></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="border-bottom:0.5pt solid #0094ff;border-top:0.5pt solid #ffffff;padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Exploration &#38; Advanced Projects ($M)</font></td><td colspan="3" style="background-color:#f2f2f2;border-bottom:0.5pt solid #0094ff;border-left:0.5pt solid #ffffff;border-top:0.5pt solid #b6b6b6;padding:2px 1pt;text-align:center;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">$450</font></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">In 2024, investment in exploration and advanced projects is expected to decrease to approximately $450 million as Newmont focuses primarily on extending mine life at existing operations and continuing to build reserves. Newmont expects to invest approximately $300 million dollars in exploration expense to progress organic growth around existing operations and brownfields and greenfields exploration projects, including Apensu and Subika Underground (Ahafo South), East Ridge (Red Chris) and Oberon (Tanami). In addition, Newmont expects to invest approximately $150 million in advanced projects spend associated with advancing studies on its robust pipeline of projects, including Galore Creek. Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">a,b</font></div></td><td colspan="3" style="background-color:#f2f2f2;border-bottom:0.5pt solid #0094ff;border-left:0.5pt solid #ffffff;border-top:0.5pt solid #b6b6b6;padding:2px 1pt;text-align:center;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">34%</font></td></tr></table></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.2pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:110%;position:relative;top:-2.8pt;vertical-align:baseline">a</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:110%"> The adjusted tax rate excludes certain items such as tax valuation allowance adjustments. </font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.2pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:110%;position:relative;top:-2.8pt;vertical-align:baseline">b</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:110%"> Assuming average prices of $1,900 per ounce for gold, $4.00 per pound for copper, $23.00 per ounce for silver, $1.00 per pound for lead, and $1.35 per pound for zinc and achievement of current production, sales and cost estimates, we estimate our consolidated adjusted effective tax rate related to continuing operations for 2024 will be 34%.  </font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">NEWMONT FULL YEAR AND FOURTH QUARTER 2023 RESULTS &#38; 2024 GUIDANCE &#124; NEWS RELEASE       &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;9</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:86.4pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><img alt="image.jpg" src="image.jpg" style="height:98px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:818px"></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">The 2024 outlook for general and administrative costs is expected to increase slightly to $300 million as Newmont continues integration work after the Newcrest transaction. Interest expense is expected to increase to approximately $365 million due to the debt assumed from the Newcrest transaction. Depreciation and amortization is expected to increase to approximately $2.9 billion for the combined portfolio. The adjusted tax rate is expected to remain stable at approximately 34 percent using a $1,900 per ounce gold price assumption.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt"><font style="margin-bottom:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Assuming a 34 percent incremental tax rate, an $100 per ounce increase in gold price would deliver an expected $675 million improvement in revenue. Included within the sensitivity is a royalty and production tax impact of $5 per ounce for every $100 per ounce change in gold price. </font></div><div Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Brucejack was acquired on November 6, 2023 through the Newcrest transaction. Following a tragic fatality on December 20, 2023, Newmont suspended mining operations at the site to conduct a full investigation into the incident. The site ramped up to full operations by the end of January 2024. In 2024, the site is focused on the integration and implementation of Newmont's Fatality Risk Management program which are designed to ensure safe operations, as well as Newmont's Full Potential program to deliver synergies. </font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="margin-bottom:2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.2pt;font-weight:400;line-height:110%;position:relative;top:-2.8pt;vertical-align:baseline">a</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:110%"> 2024 outlook projections are considered forward-looking statements and represent management&#8217;s good faith estimates or expectations of future production results as of February 22, 2024. Outlook is based upon certain assumptions, including, but not limited to, metal prices, oil prices, certain exchange rates and other assumptions. For example, 2024 Outlook assumes $1,900&#47;oz Au, $8,818&#47;tonne Cu, $23.00&#47;oz Ag, $2,976&#47;tonne Zn, $2,205&#47;tonne Pb, $0.70 AUD&#47;USD exchange rate, $0.75 CAD&#47;USD exchange rate and $90&#47;barrel WTI. Production, CAS, AISC and capital estimates exclude projects that have not yet been approved, except for Cerro Negro District Expansion 1 which is included in Outlook. The potential impact on inventory valuation as a result of lower prices, input costs, and project decisions are not included as part of this Outlook. Assumptions used for purposes of Outlook may prove to be incorrect and actual results may differ from those anticipated, including variation beyond a +&#47;-5% range. Outlook cannot be guaranteed. As such, investors are cautioned not to place undue reliance upon Outlook and forward-looking statements as there can be no assurance that the plans, assumptions or expectations upon which they are placed will occur. Amounts may not recalculate to totals due to rounding. See cautionary at the end of this release. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.2pt;font-weight:400;line-height:110%;position:relative;top:-2.8pt;vertical-align:baseline">b </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:110%">All-in sustaining costs (AISC) as used in the Company&#8217;s Outlook is a non-GAAP metric&#59; see below for further information and reconciliation to consolidated 2024 CAS outlook.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.2pt;font-weight:400;line-height:110%;position:relative;top:-2.8pt;vertical-align:baseline">c </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:110%">Consolidated production for Merian is presented on a total production basis for the mine site&#59; attributable production represents a 75% interest for Merian.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.2pt;font-weight:400;line-height:112%;position:relative;top:-2.8pt;vertical-align:baseline">d </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:112%">Represents the ownership interest in the Nevada Gold Mines (NGM) joint venture. NGM is owned 38.5% by Newmont and owned 61.5% and operated by Barrick. The Company accounts for its interest in NGM using the proportionate consolidation method, thereby recognizing its pro-rata share of the assets, liabilities and operations of NGM. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.2pt;font-weight:400;line-height:110%;position:relative;top:-2.8pt;vertical-align:baseline">e </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:110%">Attributable production includes Newmont&#8217;s 40% interest in Pueblo Viejo, which is accounted for as an equity method investment.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.2pt;font-weight:400;line-height:110%;position:relative;top:-2.8pt;vertical-align:baseline">f </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:110%">Attributable production includes Newmont&#8217;s 32% interest in Lundin Gold, who wholly owns and operates the Fruta del Norte mine, which is accounted for as an equity method investment on a quarterly-lag.</font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div
